title: Conducting Ring in a Magnetic Field

content.question: Read each question carefully. Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. A thin, conducting ring of area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is aligned in a uniform magnetic field directed to the right and perpendicular to the plane of the ring, as shown. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the magnitude of the magnetic field is <math alttext="B sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. At <math alttext="t equals 1 second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext> s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the magnitude of the magnetic field begins to decrease according to the equation <math alttext="B of t equals the fraction beta over t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="beta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has units of <math alttext="tesla seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Derive an equation for the magnitude of the induced current <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the ring as a function of <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t is greater than 1 second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mtext> s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Express your answer in terms of <math alttext="beta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate.

The ring is now mounted on an axle that is perpendicular to the magnetic field. The magnitude of the magnetic field is now held at a constant <math alttext="B sub 0 equals 0.50 tesla" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.50</mn><mtext> T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown.
